articles.title: Overseas Koreans and Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans and Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans and foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					They included the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 63rd founding anniversary of the DPRK led by Ko Tok U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and the delegation of the Newspaper Al Baath of Syria led by its General Director Abdullatif Oumran, the delegation of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea led by its Chairman Nikolai Polishk and the delegation of the Study and Research Forum of Songun Politics of the National Press Club of Nepal led by its Chairman Ram K. Karmacharya.
					
					They made bows in boundless reverence for the President who made immortal contribution to developing the Juche-oriented overseas Koreans' movement and carrying out the global cause of independence.
					
					They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Tony Tan Sworn in as Singapore's 7th President
articles.content:
Tony Tan Sworn in as Singapore's 7th President

					Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Singapore's president-elect Tony Tan Keng Yam was sworn in for a term of six years as the seventh president of the republic on Thursday.
					
					The ceremony at the Istana was witnessed by cabinet ministers, members of the judiciary, lawmakers and senior civil servants.
					
					Both President Tan and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong stressed the importance of unity for the nation in their speeches.
					
					"I will seek to work not only with the government, but also with civil society and community groups to advance the interests of all Singaporeans, whatever their political persuasions," Tan said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Peru

					Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house in Peru on August 29.
					
					The work, published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), clarifies that the invincible might of the DPRK lies in defending and eternally glorifying President Kim Il Sung's Juche-based idea and feats in state building.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by Foreign Media

					Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Various foreign media issued reports on August 25 on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The Bangladesh paper Blits carried an article titled "Formularization of Songun Idea" with a photo of the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					
					It said Kim Jong Il is brilliantly carrying forward the ideology and line of giving priority to the arms and military affairs which President Kim Il Sung put forward for the first time in history and consistently maintained during the whole period of the revolution and construction.
					
					During the days of Songun leadership Kim Jong Il comprehensively systematized, developed and enriched the Juche-oriented military idea and theory initiated by the President as required by the developing revolution, it noted.
					
					The Ugandan National Radio said the independent dignity of the Korean people has remarkably grown and a solid foundation for realizing the reunification of the country was laid thanks to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il. This resulted in strengthening the international position and prestige of the DPRK.
					
					The Guinean domestic radio praised the more than half a century-long history of his Songun leadership and noted the victory achieved by Korean people in carrying out the cause of socialism is an inevitable product of history brought about by Songun. 
					
					The DPRK standing with dignity in confrontation with the U.S. which styles itself the world's "only superpower" eloquently proves that the DPRK is, indeed, an invincible power that no one dares to provoke, it said.
					
					The Guinean international radio and the 7 national languages radio aired the same content.

articles.title: Advantageous Education System of DPRK Praised by Various Countries
articles.content:
Advantageous Education System of DPRK Praised by Various Countries

					Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Media of several countries widely introduced the advantageous socialist education system of the DPRK in which the whole country turned into an institute of learning.
					
					ATV station of Egypt noted that President Kim Il Sung had already enforced the various popular policies including the free education system at the guerilla bases in the period of the arduous anti-Japanese war. Today this has become the historical roots and brilliant tradition of the education in the DPRK, it added.
					
					The Chinese People's Daily said that attaching importance to education is a tradition of the DPRK. It went on:
					
					Kim Il Sung made public "Theses on Socialist Education" on Sept. 5, 1977 to comprehensively clarify the orientation and ways of improving education.
					
					The universal 11-year compulsory education is in force in the DPRK. The state bears all the expenses for education and even the parents do not worry about their children's uniforms.
					
					University and college students receive scholarships from the state.
					
					The Nepali paper Arpan noted that the free education system in the DPRK is very wide and comprehensive in its subject and range. Not only the school education for the new generation but also various kinds of social education for people at job is free. The education of officials and working people is also provided at the state expense, it added.
					
					The Apsara Television and Radio of Cambodia stressed that the ultra modern technologies possessed by some developed countries in the world are being researched and developed by the internal scientific and technological forces in the DPRK. This is a manifestation of the successful training of talents, successful education in the DPRK, it added.
					
					The Science Technology and Education News of India said that in the DPRK all the people ranging from children to adults are under the relevant education system and all the education is free, a point that attracts increasingly greater attention of the international community.
					
					The internet homepage of the Ukrainian Independence Federation noted that under the deep care of leader Kim Jong Il the state investment in education is increasing in the DPRK and the country is positively supporting the education.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Demands Fundamental Changeover in Confrontation Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Demands Fundamental Changeover in Confrontation Policy

					Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea issued a commentary as regards the replacement of the minister of "Unification" on August 31.
					
					The commentary said that Hyon In Thaek was released from office of minister of "Unification" but the authorities appointed him as a special aide to "president" for unification policy and clarified that they would "maintain the consistency of the unification policy". This indicates that there is no change in their "policy towards the north" in fact, it added.
					
					Saying that they can not deceive the people with the personnel reshuffle without policy switchover, the commentary urged the "government" to make fundamental change in the confrontation policy and make efforts to normalize the south-north relations.
					
					If the "government" is set to temporarily tide over a political crisis, it will not be able to escape a severe judgment by the people, the commentary warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Military Authorities Denounced for Suppressing Religious Freedom
articles.content:
S. Korean Military Authorities Denounced for Suppressing Religious Freedom

					Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Believers of the Hyangrin Church in south Korea held a prayer meeting on August 28 to denounce the military authorities for suppressing the believers by invoking the "National Security Law".
					
					They accused the Defense Security Command of investigating several times Sol Tu Bok, a believer of the church who works at the south Korea-U.S. "combined forces command," on alleged violation of the fascist law.
					
					The matters which the Defense Security Command termed violation of the law were a letter of introduction he presented to the church, his participation in a signature campaign demanding the conclusion of a peace treaty and his church services at Taechu-ri, a village in Phyongthaek, south Korea, they said.
					
					He became a victim of the evil law which suppresses even the freedom of legitimate religious activities, they noted.
					
					They called for an immediate abolition of such a bad law and a stop to the suppression of the religionists.
					
					A protest letter to the defense minister was made public.
					
					The church has held a demonstration outside the National Defense Ministry in protest against the suppression of Sol from August 23.
